text: Zhang Xinshi (; June 30, 1934 - September 24, 2020) was a Chinese plant ecologist. He was the founder of China's vegetation ecology and international information ecology. He created China's first laboratory of quantitative vegetation ecology. He was a member of the 8th, 9th and 10th Standing Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference. In 1991, he became a member of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. Zhang was born in Kaifeng, Henan. Zhang died on September 24, 2020 in Seattle, Washington at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Ecologists Category:Chinese scientists Category:People from Henan Category:20th-century Chinese scientists
title: Zhang Xinshi
